00:00:38:210000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:00:38:210000.Dialogue: Professor Jones told the symposium he had a new method for calculating the mass of a muon. Five times the limit of (laughs) 'E' to the upsilon as...

00:00:53:090000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:00:53:090000.Dialogue: Okay. No, no. I'll start over. Professor...

00:01:00:070000.Speaker: Howard
00:01:00:070000.Dialogue: I haven't seen him laugh that hard since the day Leonard made that multiplication error.

00:01:05:060000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:01:05:060000.Dialogue: Oh, Oh, Lord, that multiplication error! He thought he carried the one. But he didn't.

00:01:12:160000.Speaker: Leonard
00:01:12:160000.Dialogue: It's not funny. That mistake got published.

00:01:15:080000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:01:15:080000.Dialogue: Stop! I'm going to wet myself!

00:01:18:010000.Speaker: Raj
00:01:18:010000.Dialogue: Hey, guys, guys, President Siebert is headed this way.

00:01:22:230000.Speaker: Leonard
00:01:22:230000.Dialogue: Doesn't look happy, so I'm guessing he wants to talk to Sheldon.

00:01:27:030000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:01:27:030000.Dialogue: Oh, President Siebert, I assume you'd like to respond to one of the suggestions I put in the box by your office.

00:01:33:170000.Speaker: Seibert
00:01:33:170000.Dialogue: No, and stop installing suggestion boxes everywhere.

00:01:37:030000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:01:37:030000.Dialogue: You don't like written suggestions. You don't like when I give them to you while we're urinating in the men's room. If I didn't know you any better, I'd say that you're one of those stubborn people who are not open to suggestions.

00:01:47:230000.Speaker: Seibert
00:01:47:230000.Dialogue: Dr. Cooper, the physics department chair tells me you're refusing to take your vacation.

00:01:54:020000.Speaker: Seibert
00:01:54:020000.Dialogue: You're obligated to take one. And I'd also like you to know the most-often received suggestion in my suggestion box you installed without asking me is Can Dr. Cooper take a vacation?

00:02:03:180000.Speaker: Seibert
00:02:03:180000.Dialogue: Okay, settled, then. I'll see y'all of you Monday, except for you.

00:02:07:170000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:02:07:170000.Dialogue: But if I don't come into work, what am I supposed to do with myself?

00:02:10:130000.Speaker: Seibert
00:02:10:130000.Dialogue: Read, rest, travel. I hear Afghanistan is nice this time of year.

00:03:11:230000.Scene: Leonard’s car. Leonard is singing enthusiastically.
00:03:11:230000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:03:11:230000.Dialogue: Good Lord! Would you stop that caterwauling!

00:03:18:200000.Scene: Leonard’s car. Leonard is singing enthusiastically.
00:03:18:200000.Speaker: Leonard
00:03:18:200000.Dialogue: What the hell are you doing?!

00:03:20:120000.Scene: Leonard’s car. Leonard is singing enthusiastically.
00:03:20:120000.Speaker: Sheldon

00:03:23:060000.Scene: Leonard’s car. Leonard is singing enthusiastically.
00:03:23:060000.Speaker: Leonard
00:03:23:060000.Dialogue: What are you doing hiding back there?

00:03:25:050000.Scene: Leonard’s car. Leonard is singing enthusiastically.
00:03:25:050000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:03:25:050000.Dialogue: I'm sneaking into work. Now, if the guard at the university asks what's under the blanket, you tell him it's some lobster traps.

00:03:32:100000.Scene: Leonard’s car. Leonard is singing enthusiastically.
00:03:32:100000.Speaker: Leonard

00:03:38:190000.Scene: Leonard’s car. Leonard is singing enthusiastically.
00:03:38:190000.Speaker: Leonard
00:03:38:190000.Dialogue: What are you going to do when you get to the university? People are going to recognize you.

00:03:44:160000.Scene: Leonard’s car. Leonard is singing enthusiastically.
00:03:44:160000.Speaker: Sheldon

00:03:50:180000.Scene: Leonard’s car. Leonard is singing enthusiastically.
00:03:50:180000.Speaker: Leonard
00:03:50:180000.Dialogue: Fine. Just get back under your blanket, and I'll drive you there.

00:03:56:190000.Scene: Leonard’s car. Leonard is singing enthusiastically.
00:03:56:190000.Speaker: Sheldon

00:03:59:230000.Scene: Leonard’s car. Leonard is singing enthusiastically.
00:03:59:230000.Speaker: Leonard

00:04:05:130000.Scene: Leonard’s car. Leonard is singing enthusiastically.
00:04:05:130000.Speaker: Shledon
00:04:05:130000.Dialogue: SHELDON: I have GPS on my phone.

00:04:07:220000.Scene: Leonard’s car. Leonard is singing enthusiastically.
00:04:07:220000.Speaker: Sheldon

00:04:11:220000.Speaker: Penny
00:04:11:220000.Dialogue: I'm so glad you talked Howard out of having your wedding invitations in Klingon.

00:04:22:170000.Speaker: Bernadette
00:04:22:170000.Dialogue: I'm hoping my relatives think it's Hebrew.

00:04:27:120000.Speaker: Amy
00:04:27:120000.Dialogue: This is really happening. I'm gonna be a maid of honor. I'm gonna wear a beautiful dress and walk down that aisle and, finally, I will have my special day.

00:04:39:230000.Speaker: Amy
00:04:39:230000.Dialogue: They're gonna need an extra- large veil for somebody's head.

00:04:44:210000.Speaker: Bernadette
00:04:44:210000.Dialogue: If I ever actually ever get married.

00:04:48:090000.Speaker: Bernadette
00:04:48:090000.Dialogue: My dad... 'Cause I make a lot more money than Howie, he's putting a lot of pressure on me to get a prenup.

00:04:57:160000.Speaker: Amy
00:04:57:160000.Dialogue: Parental pressure can be daunting. I remember the battle with my mother about shaving my legs.

00:05:04:050000.Speaker: Amy
00:05:04:050000.Dialogue: Last year, I finally gave in and let her do it.

00:05:08:230000.Speaker: Bernadette
00:05:08:230000.Dialogue: I just don't know how I'm gonna break it to him.

00:05:11:200000.Speaker: Penny
00:05:11:200000.Dialogue: You know, I'm a big believer in breaking bad news to a guy when you're in bed with him. That's how I told my high school boyfriend I slept with his brother.

00:05:19:060000.Speaker: Penny
00:05:19:060000.Dialogue: That's how I told his brother the same thing.

00:05:23:070000.Speaker: Bernadette
00:05:23:070000.Dialogue: I don't know, I don't want to manipulate him with sex.

00:05:25:230000.Speaker: Penny
00:05:25:230000.Dialogue: Oh, sweetie, that's what sex is for.

00:05:29:150000.Speaker: Amy
00:05:29:150000.Dialogue: You know, the connection between marriage and money is nothing new. In fact, the term wed referred to the money and livestock that the groom paid the bride's father. For example, you're adorable, intelligent and a good earner. I could conservatively see you going for at least two oxen and a goose.

00:05:52:140000.Speaker: Leonard
00:05:52:140000.Dialogue: Sheldon, there are a million great vacations you could take. What about Hawaii?

00:05:57:010000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:05:57:010000.Dialogue: Hawaii is a former leper colony on top of an active volcano where the disappointing ending to Lost was filmed.

00:06:10:150000.Speaker: Howard
00:06:10:150000.Dialogue: How about Florida? They got Cape Canaveral, they got Disney, they got my Aunt Ida and the world's largest collection of diabetic candy. Plus, if you get sweaty enough, her plastic-covered furniture is like a flume ride.

00:06:23:230000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:06:23:230000.Dialogue: My family took a trip to Florida when I was a child. A seagull stole a hot dog from me on the beach.

00:06:34:060000.Speaker: Raj
00:06:34:060000.Dialogue: You know, if I had a week off, I'd go back to the Two Bunch Palms Resort and Spa in the desert. I tell you, an hour on the massage table with Trevor, and you'll feel like you were born without bones.

00:06:44:120000.Speaker: Howard
00:06:44:120000.Dialogue: I don't think I could ever let a guy give me a massage.

00:06:48:160000.Speaker: Raj
00:06:48:160000.Dialogue: Really? What was I doing to your neck last night while you were playing X-Box?

00:06:54:060000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:06:54:060000.Dialogue: It's like I'm living in a dictatorship. You must take a vacation, you must have fun, you must enjoy life.

00:07:02:010000.Speaker: Howard
00:07:02:010000.Dialogue: I don't think you have a good handle on dictatorships.

00:07:07:230000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:07:07:230000.Dialogue: One time they tried to make Richard Feynman take a vacation, but he chose instead to expand his mind and learn something new. He went to work in his friend's biology lab. Richard Feynman was a famous American physicist, part of the Manhattan Project.

00:07:20:230000.Speaker: Howard
00:07:20:230000.Dialogue: Everyone in the world of science knows who Richard Feynman was.

00:07:29:230000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:07:29:230000.Dialogue: Oh! I have a brilliant idea. Amy's a biologist. I'll go work in her lab.

00:07:38:010000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:07:38:010000.Dialogue: Ten seconds ago, you never heard of him. Now you're an expert.

00:07:45:200000.Speaker: Leonard
00:07:45:200000.Dialogue: Is that your laundry? You only have, like, six things in there.

00:07:49:090000.Speaker: Penny
00:07:49:090000.Dialogue: Yeah, I didn't have any quarters, so I've been sneaking stuff into other people's loads all day.

00:07:54:110000.Speaker: Penny
00:07:54:110000.Dialogue: Hey, if I tell you something, will you promise not to tell anybody?

00:07:57:160000.Speaker: Leonard
00:07:57:160000.Dialogue: It doesn't matter what I say, you're gonna tell me anyway.

00:07:59:180000.Speaker: Penny
00:07:59:180000.Dialogue: What? That is not true. Bernadette wants a prenup.

00:08:10:060000.Speaker: Penny
00:08:10:060000.Dialogue: So you're saying if I became a famous movie star, we got married, you wouldn't sign a prenup?

00:08:15:040000.Speaker: Leonard
00:08:15:040000.Dialogue: Absolutely not. If I'm gonna be stuck at home with the kids while you're on location cheating on me with Ryan Gosling...

00:08:23:180000.Speaker: Leonard
00:08:23:180000.Dialogue: then Leonard gots to get paid.

00:08:27:090000.Speaker: Leonard
00:08:27:090000.Dialogue: So, you think about us getting married?

00:08:30:110000.Speaker: Penny
00:08:30:110000.Dialogue: I think about a lot of things. I think about us getting married, I think about us breaking up. Once in a while, I think about how I didn't leave a note on that Mercedes I dinged in the parking lot last month, but then I have a glass of wine and it passes.

00:08:42:130000.Speaker: Leonard
00:08:42:130000.Dialogue: Joke all you want, but you think about it.

00:08:45:180000.Speaker: Penny
00:08:45:180000.Dialogue: Well, tell you one thing, if I ever do get married, no Klingon invitations.

00:08:50:110000.Speaker: Leonard
00:08:50:110000.Dialogue: Good luck catching a man with that attitude.

00:08:55:150000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:08:55:150000.Dialogue: Boy, oh, boy! This vacation is off to a wonderful start. The smell of formaldehyde... the whir of the centrifuge, the distant chatter of lab animals being dispatched for dissection. Mm, I can already feel my cares just melting away.

00:09:15:110000.Speaker: Amy
00:09:15:110000.Dialogue: I'm excited to work with my boyfriend. It's gonna be romantic.

00:09:20:210000.Speaker: Amy
00:09:20:210000.Dialogue: Come on, Sheldon. We can be like Marie Curie and her husband, Pierre, who spent their days working side by side, bathed in the glow of their love and the radium that ultimately killed her.

00:09:32:030000.Speaker: Amy
00:09:32:030000.Dialogue: Screw Beauty and the Beast; that's the love story Disney should tell.

00:09:35:230000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:09:35:230000.Dialogue: Okay, what do we start with? Maybe splicing some genes, clone a sheep, perhaps grow a human ear on a mouse's back? Ha-ha, I'm a freak!

00:09:49:210000.Speaker: Amy
00:09:49:210000.Dialogue: Oh, I'm gonna be doing some brain stem histology while you put yourself on the business end of a sponge and wash those beakers.

00:09:57:080000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:09:57:080000.Dialogue: Wash those bea... Oh, I get it, a little hazing for the new fella. Yeah, I'd better keep and eye out for, what, shoe polish on the microscope, or mad cow disease in my grilled cheese sandwich?

00:10:09:160000.Speaker: Amy
00:10:09:160000.Dialogue: No, I just need those beakers washed. Hippity-hop, quick like a bunny.

00:10:12:200000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:10:12:200000.Dialogue: Wha...? Excuse me, you have Dr. Sheldon Cooper in your lab. You're gonna make him do the dishes? That's like asking the Incredible Hulk to open a pickle jar.

00:10:24:010000.Speaker: Amy
00:10:24:010000.Dialogue: Sheldon, you've never worked in a lab like this before. You have no experience in the field of biology.

00:10:29:060000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:10:29:060000.Dialogue: I have plenty of experience in biology. I bought a Tamagotchi in 1998. And... it's still alive. Let's do this.

00:10:55:180000.Speaker: Leonard
00:10:55:180000.Dialogue: I'm sorry. So, listen, I heard something about him. Can you keep it between us?

00:11:02:110000.Speaker: Raj
00:11:02:110000.Dialogue: Ooh, gossip. When I first got here, I thought you Americans really gossiped around the water cooler. So I hung out there for, like, a month, but the only gossip I ever heard was about some creepy guy hanging out by the water cooler.

00:11:15:160000.Speaker: Leonard
00:11:15:160000.Dialogue: Bernadette wants to get a prenup.

00:11:18:020000.Speaker: Raj
00:11:18:020000.Dialogue: Oh, that's a shame-- he's gonna be devastated.

00:11:21:000000.Speaker: Leonard
00:11:21:000000.Dialogue: I never know what to do in these situations. Should I give him a heads-up?

00:11:24:130000.Speaker: Raj
00:11:24:130000.Dialogue: Hmm. I'm gonna give you the same advice I yell at the TV when the Bachelor's handing out roses.

00:11:35:070000.Speaker: Howard
00:11:35:070000.Dialogue: Check it out. Look at the size of that Rice Krispie Treat! Same price.

00:11:41:190000.Speaker: Leonard
00:11:41:190000.Dialogue: Hey, Howard, I need to tell you something.

00:11:44:070000.Speaker: Howard
00:11:44:070000.Dialogue: I know, it's not on my wedding diet. I don't care.

00:11:49:110000.Speaker: Leonard
00:11:49:110000.Dialogue: Uh, l-listen, I... heard that Bernadette's thinking about asking you for a prenup.

00:12:14:000000.Speaker: Howard
00:12:14:000000.Dialogue: You know what, it's... not a big deal. She makes more money than me. She wants to protect her financial interests. It's completely reasonable.

00:12:26:160000.Speaker: Howard
00:12:26:160000.Dialogue: Yeah, actually, it's good for both of us. I have assets to protect, too.

00:12:32:080000.Speaker: Howard
00:12:32:080000.Dialogue: I've got some rare comic books. The Vespa's almost paid off.

00:12:38:060000.Speaker: Howard
00:12:38:060000.Dialogue: And Ma and I have a primo double cemetery plot at Mt. Sinai right near the guy who played Mr. Roper on Three's Company.

00:12:48:210000.Speaker: Raj
00:12:48:210000.Dialogue: You can't just spring that on a guy!

00:12:53:010000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:12:53:010000.Dialogue: Here you go. This is now the only lab with glassware washed by a man with two doctorates and a restraining order signed by Carl Sagan.

00:13:05:190000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:13:05:190000.Dialogue: Y... You're being ridiculous! Those are perfectly clean.

00:13:09:190000.Speaker: Amy
00:13:09:190000.Dialogue: Sheldon, this beaker used to contain cerebral spinal fluid from an elephant that died of syphilis. If it's, in fact, perfectly clean, drink from it.

00:13:28:110000.Speaker: Amy
00:13:28:110000.Dialogue: All right, perhaps this task will be a little bit more up your alley. I need you to count the bacteria spores on these petri dishes.

00:13:35:110000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:13:35:110000.Dialogue: There was something wrong with that detergent. That was way too bubbly.

00:13:44:100000.Speaker: Amy
00:13:44:100000.Dialogue: Yeah, good for you. Now, start counting.

00:13:47:230000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:13:47:230000.Dialogue: You know what this place needs? A suggestion box.

00:13:59:100000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:13:59:100000.Dialogue: How's counting going? When I was in kindergarten, I recited pi to a thousand places for the school talent show. I think I got this.

00:14:22:090000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:14:22:090000.Dialogue: This is preposterous! I think you're giving me these tasks because you're afraid if you give me anything meaningful to do, I'll show you up.

00:14:30:200000.Speaker: Amy
00:14:30:200000.Dialogue: Really? Is that what you think?

00:14:33:180000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:14:33:180000.Dialogue: Yes, that's what I think. And I'm super smart, so it's probably true.

00:14:39:010000.Speaker: Amy
00:14:39:010000.Dialogue: Hey, I've been training in the field of neurobiology for 12 years. You've been here for three hours, and you've spent one of them in the bathroom.

00:14:46:050000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:14:46:050000.Dialogue: I'm sorry! It takes me a while to get things going on an unfamiliar toilet.

00:14:51:080000.Speaker: Amy
00:14:51:080000.Dialogue: Sheldon, I've given you the simplest things to do, and you haven't done one of them right.

00:14:56:010000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:14:56:010000.Dialogue: Maybe that's because I'm not being challenged. It's the same reason Einstein failed math.

00:15:00:130000.Speaker: Amy
00:15:00:130000.Dialogue: Maybe the math was too bubbly for him.

00:15:02:180000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:15:02:180000.Dialogue: You think you're doing science by cutting up that brain? They could do the same thing at any Quiznos. And they'd offer to toast it for me, too.

00:15:11:140000.Speaker: Amy
00:15:11:140000.Dialogue: Okay, smart guy. I'm about to remove the locus coeruleus, which is incredibly delicate work. Have at it.

00:15:20:220000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:15:20:220000.Dialogue: All right. I'm no stranger to a little gray matter.

00:15:37:040000.Speaker: Amy
00:15:37:040000.Dialogue: You're getting warmer-- it is, indeed, in the brain. Hope your hands are steady. It's the width of a single hair. But this is just biology, so I'm sure it's no problem for a genius like you.

00:15:48:210000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:15:48:210000.Dialogue: It's not. I'll have you know, in the field of physics, we work with particles so small, they make fat jokes about the locus coeruleus.

00:15:57:140000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:15:57:140000.Dialogue: I.e., when your locus coeruleus sits around the house, it sits around the house.

00:16:07:010000.Speaker: Amy
00:16:07:010000.Dialogue: Oh... are we nervous, Dr. Cooper?

00:16:09:150000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:16:09:150000.Dialogue: No. What you see is a man trembling with confidence.

00:16:20:060000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:16:20:060000.Dialogue: Does a locus coeruleus normally bleed that much?

00:16:40:030000.Scene: The bar at the Cheesecake Factory.
00:16:40:030000.Speaker: Howard

00:16:42:080000.Scene: The bar at the Cheesecake Factory.
00:16:42:080000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:16:42:080000.Dialogue: I'm on vacation. Social convention dictates that I let my hair down at a local watering hole.

00:16:52:000000.Scene: The bar at the Cheesecake Factory.
00:16:52:000000.Speaker: Sheldon

00:16:55:120000.Scene: The bar at the Cheesecake Factory.
00:16:55:120000.Speaker: Howard

00:16:57:230000.Scene: The bar at the Cheesecake Factory.
00:16:57:230000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:16:57:230000.Dialogue: You know, I have ten fingers and ten toes. If I tell you a story about each one of them, we'll be here all day-- let's just move on.

00:17:04:110000.Scene: The bar at the Cheesecake Factory.
00:17:04:110000.Speaker: Barman

00:17:06:060000.Scene: The bar at the Cheesecake Factory.
00:17:06:060000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:17:06:060000.Dialogue: Ah, seeing as I'm on vacation, uh, piña colada seems appropriate. Extra pineapple slices, extra whipped cream, extra cherries, extra umbrellas, and, uh, hold the rum.

00:17:19:210000.Scene: The bar at the Cheesecake Factory.
00:17:19:210000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:17:19:210000.Dialogue: Don't let me have too many of those.

00:17:23:050000.Scene: The bar at the Cheesecake Factory.
00:17:23:050000.Speaker: Penny
00:17:23:050000.Dialogue: Hey, what are you guys doing here?

00:17:24:210000.Scene: The bar at the Cheesecake Factory.
00:17:24:210000.Speaker: Howard
00:17:24:210000.Dialogue: We're grown men; we drink at bars.

00:17:28:010000.Scene: The bar at the Cheesecake Factory.
00:17:28:010000.Speaker: Penny

00:17:32:090000.Scene: The bar at the Cheesecake Factory.
00:17:32:090000.Speaker: Penny
00:17:32:090000.Dialogue: Everything okay with you and Bernadette?

00:17:34:120000.Scene: The bar at the Cheesecake Factory.
00:17:34:120000.Speaker: Howard

00:17:36:130000.Scene: The bar at the Cheesecake Factory.
00:17:36:130000.Speaker: Penny

00:17:38:050000.Scene: The bar at the Cheesecake Factory.
00:17:38:050000.Speaker: Sheldon

00:17:41:100000.Scene: The bar at the Cheesecake Factory.
00:17:41:100000.Speaker: Penny
00:17:41:100000.Dialogue: You know those girls text me every detail of their lives as it happens.

00:17:45:050000.Scene: The bar at the Cheesecake Factory.
00:17:45:050000.Speaker: Howard

00:17:47:150000.Scene: The bar at the Cheesecake Factory.
00:17:47:150000.Speaker: Penny
00:17:47:150000.Dialogue: All right, Howard Wolowitz, listen up. You sign anything she puts in front of you, because you are the luckiest man alive. If you let her go, there is no way you can find anyone else-- speaking on behalf of all women, it is not gonna happen; we had a meeting.

00:18:01:180000.Scene: The bar at the Cheesecake Factory.
00:18:01:180000.Speaker: Penny
00:18:01:180000.Dialogue: And you, a grown man fainting at the sight of a little blood.

00:18:05:220000.Scene: The bar at the Cheesecake Factory.
00:18:05:220000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:18:05:220000.Dialogue: Excuse me, this is a fairly substantial wound. You...

00:18:23:110000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:18:23:110000.Dialogue: I was kind of hoping I could continue vacationing in your laboratory. After all, I did book the whole week.

00:18:33:130000.Speaker: Amy
00:18:33:130000.Dialogue: Do you honestly think you can just waltz back in here after the way you behaved yesterday?

00:18:38:070000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:18:38:070000.Dialogue: I was not myself. I had lost a lot of thumb blood.

00:18:53:120000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:18:53:120000.Dialogue: I'm sorry that you weren't able to...

00:19:13:220000.Speaker: Amy
00:19:13:220000.Dialogue: You're forgiven. Now, if you want to stay, get started on those beakers. They're still dirty from yesterday.

00:19:25:070000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:19:25:070000.Dialogue: Next year I'm going to Epcot.

00:19:39:220000.Speaker: Howard
00:19:39:220000.Dialogue: No. I'm not mad at you. I just... wish you would have come to me, so I didn't have to hear it through the nerd-vine.

00:19:50:050000.Speaker: Bernadette
00:19:50:050000.Dialogue: So, what are we gonna do?

00:19:53:050000.Speaker: Howard
00:19:53:050000.Dialogue: You really want me to sign a prenup?

00:19:55:130000.Speaker: Bernadette
00:19:55:130000.Dialogue: I don't know. My dad's pretty insistent on it, though.

00:19:59:060000.Speaker: Howard
00:19:59:060000.Dialogue: Why don't I talk to your dad, man-to-man?

00:20:02:120000.Speaker: Bernadette
00:20:02:120000.Dialogue: Really? Oh, that'd be so great!

00:20:06:170000.Speaker: Bernadette
00:20:06:170000.Dialogue: I should probably give you a heads-up about a couple of things.

00:20:11:200000.Speaker: Bernadette
00:20:11:200000.Dialogue: Even though he's retired from the police force, he still carries his gun.

00:20:16:200000.Speaker: Bernadette
00:20:16:200000.Dialogue: But don't worry, he won't shoot it. It's more of a fashion statement.

00:20:23:050000.Speaker: Bernadette
00:20:23:050000.Dialogue: And just to be safe, when you talk to him, don't bring up Jimmy Carter, gardeners, foreign people, homosexuals, Sean Penn, Vatican II, gun control, organic food, the designated hitter rule, recycling or the fact that you're Jewish.

00:20:39:060000.Speaker: Howard
00:20:39:060000.Dialogue: Got it, got it. Will you e-mail me that list?

00:20:44:230000.Speaker: Bernadette
00:20:44:230000.Dialogue: So the thing to watch for, if he's shouting at you, you're okay, but if he starts to get real quiet, leave as quickly as you can without making eye contact.

00:20:55:150000.Speaker: Bernadette
00:20:55:150000.Dialogue: Not in a straight line-- throw some zigs and zigs in there.

00:21:01:120000.Speaker: Howard
00:21:01:120000.Dialogue: You know, this isn't that pressing. Why don't I talk to him about it in May.

00:21:06:020000.Speaker: Bernadette
00:21:06:020000.Dialogue: In May you're gonna be on the International Space Station.
